Do you own a real-world pet?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Town Hall (Polls): Polls on Other Subjects: Do you own a real-world pet?
By Lisa Shock on Saturday, November 1, 2003 - 07:56 pm:

Just for fun, I thought I'd see how many people here like, and manage to have, real pets.

I have a cat that I found with a broken foot, almost dead from starvation at a Toys R Us store. She lives indoors exclusively now.

In the past I have raised exotic goldfish (large rare ones), and birds, all of whom were adopted as unwanted and given to kind homes when I left Santa Fe to marry my husband. As a kid, after my parents moved out to the country, we had dogs, cats, goldfish, ducks plus a variety of wild visitors including bears, deer, turkeys, and snakes.

By Infernus on Saturday, November 1, 2003 - 08:00 pm:

I have tropical fish(2 tanks worth) and two dogs. The dogs and one tank worth are family pets, while the other tank is mine alone. It's only 10 gallons, but I plan to upgrade eventually.

By DarkPalidan on Saturday, November 1, 2003 - 08:06 pm:

I've had fish but they all died. I had a dog but my parents gave him away (so they say) while I was at school one day.

By Trousle on Saturday, November 1, 2003 - 09:50 pm:

I have a cat which I found sick and abandoned out in my front yard. It had a respiratory infection (aka, 'a cold') and an eye infection. Both curable. I don't know who left it out to die, but they need to be shot in the hands and feet and left outside for a week. Let's see them treat a little kitten like that again.

Anyway, she's a little grey kitten (well, a cat now. We've had her for a while.) She's very adorable and very weird. She attacks plastic bags and then crawls into them and curls up to pounce on us as we walk by. She follows us around the house attacking our feet when she gets a chance and then dashing away to hide again. We named her Shadow Chaser because of this odd behavior... we didn't know about her facsination with bags until after we had named her though ... =)

Trousle

By John Hawley on Sunday, November 2, 2003 - 02:19 am:

Two dogs. Kasumi, a Golden Lab/Chow mix, which means she is about as bright as a brick and nearly as stubborn as I am (and an escape artist par excellence) and Honey, a Border Collie/something mix without the long hair, who is indeed a honey and just lives for the times I come out the door to pet her. Both kind and friendly as the day is long, so long as I am home. From reports I get from family, you do not want to enter my yard when I am not home...

By Nate Railsback on Sunday, November 2, 2003 - 05:25 am:

I've got a white rat named Emma who is very cuddly and extremely intelligent (we leave the top of her cage open most of the time, and she knows not to go wandering or make a mess). For a lot longer, though, I've had a black-and-grey cat named Holly and a black-and-white cat named Sam. Holly is pretty normal as far as cats go, while Sam has the brain of a dog-- he's affectionate, clumsy, plays fetch, drinks out of the toilet on occassion, listens to commands, and is all in all much like a dog except (generally) self-cleaning and able to purr.

By Brick on Sunday, November 2, 2003 - 08:45 am:

Wow! I always wanted a hedgehog, but my family wants 'normal pets' -_- Anyhoo, I have a guinea pig named Ray (Raymond, actually, but I call him Ray.), and an old blind guinea pig named Avery. Ray is from a no-kill shelter, and Avery is from my mom's friend, who is amazed he still lives. I have a bunny, but... she actually leans outside of her cage like a baby bird to urinate! O_o Very hard to clean up after. My favourite pet of all time, is Sunny. I got her from a pound in Toronto. She looked very unattractive to everybody but me, because she was poop-rolled-in and was trying to pull everybody into the cage with her. Mom and Dad don't like her at all, but I love her! She's big and black and friendly and it's fun to romp around in the snow with her. But apparently they don't like her because she's 'stupid' :| Why do they care? I'm the one who cleans up the kitchen when Dad didn't let her out while I was upstairs... Heh, I didn't mean to go on that long, but you got me started on Sunny! ^.^

By Max on Sunday, November 2, 2003 - 09:24 am:

I have a dog, Mia, and a cat, Skittles. Skittles was given to us after my aunt's cat had kittens - twice. She's quite mad, also attacks and jumps into plastic bags, lets you rub her for about 15 seconds and then attacks your fingers, and doesn't like Mia at all.

Mia is a Wexford Terrier that we got from a shelter cause her owner couldn't look after her anymore. She's playful, caring and just about everything that anyone could want in a dog. She does, however, have an annoying habit of hogging my bed and then giving you a big guilty look when you try and move her. Shes usually quite wary of Skittles (unless she's outside, whereupon she tears after her quite happily).

By Bloodluvingirl on Sunday, November 2, 2003 - 08:27 pm:

Right now I have a cat, a Budgie, and 3 spiders (2 camel-back spiders and 1 blackwidow).

My cat's name is Mathias and when I got him, he was so small and such a little runt he could easily fit in just the palm of your hand. Now he's around 16 or 17 pounds, and of course is quite the giant. He was very sick when I got him and I had to nurse him back to health. He needed to be kept warm at night so I let him sleep with me, but even though he would make it to the litter to go to the washroom, the poo would get stuck to his bum and he would drag it back into the bed with me.... :/ Oh well. I used to own lots of mice so I'm used to getting pooed on.

Our other cat Shade(my brother's), was in bad shape when we got her. She had been bitten by a large dog and her side had been badly infected, and the top layer of her skin, including the fur came off around the whole bite area. Now she has a large bald scar on her side, but she is such a sweety, who cares what she looks like.

My Dad says it's very likely we saved both our cats lives.

Oh yeah I almost forgot. I also have a pigeon. She was wild but was hurt somehow and now one of her wings doesn't work anymore, so we take care of her.

Well that's it, as you can see, we love the hard luck cases.

By Mra2 Rancher on Monday, July 24, 2006 - 10:18 am:

I have two cats: Snowy and Radiator. Snowy is a male white and gold Siamese cat, he hides a lot but when he is not hiding he has a friendly disposition. Radiator is a male American Longhair and is white and orange. He is always following me around and sometimes he bites and scratches but he is VERY friendly to people he's never seen before. I got Snowy from my cousin who has about 10 different animals and couldn't stand getting another, but she liked Snowy so much she wanted him to be in the family. I got Radiator from an animal shelter and when I went to get him the manager of the animal shelter told me that his name is Radiator because he was found in one.

By Burningsock on Thursday, March 27, 2008 - 05:36 pm:

I curently have two cats Kävik and Nekko. Kävik is Inuit for wolverine and he was very aggressive as a kitten and Nekko means cat in japanese(the accual spelling of the word is neko but I spell his name with 2 "k"s)because I have always have a cat named cat in a different language(one of my past cats was named Koshka which is cat in Russian). I got Nekko for free because I had discovered him in the kitten area of petsmart when I was 6 and I made my mom drive me to the store everyday after that so I could visit him. I even named him while he was still in the store, but since my mom was in the middle of switching jobs we could not afford to get him. After a few weeks of visiting him every day the store manager decided to give him to us for free as long as we paid for his shots. This just goes to show you that when it comes to cute little kittens people become alot kinder because cats are just that awesome! But throughout my life I have had 7 cats even though I am only 15, and my earliest memorys are of playing with my 4 cats when I was 3(Koshka being one of them). Sorry for the long post i just love my kittys :)
